intro: Glossocarya premnoides, commonly known as the slender-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, with five petals. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
